content.description:
A good quality offwidth, though having to climb over a few chockstones at the chimney start detracts a bit.

Once you're established in the crack enjoy a good grovel, starting wide and slowly pinching down to wide hands. At the top head left of the summit block to Winter Prime anchors.

For my partner and I the hardest moves were the first few feet of the proper crack, get a #6 plugged in and go for it.
content.protection: BD #3-#6 for the wide crack, a single small cam to protect the topout (BD #0.5). I used a 9 inch cam to help protect the opening moves, but I don't believe it's required.
content.location: First wide crack directly to the right of Winter Prime, shares anchors up top.
